newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani cotton rates up on fear of shortage.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani cotton rates up on fear of shortage.

text.p: Pakistani cotton rates rose on Sunday as spinners covered their requirements, fearing a shortage of quality cotton, but dealers said the market was likely to remain steady to weak on Monday.
"Rates have already risen quite high," said dealer Mustafa Hussain said. He predicted that the buying spree would subside and prices would ease.
In the kerb market NIAB-78 variety was traded at 2,150 rupees ($53.45) per maund (37.32 kg), dealers said.
